channel.title: The Realityseeker/Realmfinder
channel.description:
I'm on phone so sorry lol
The Realityseeker - Blue Dragon Social
Warp Perception (Passive) - Both you and your target is immune to occupation, Redirection, Conversion and death in a Alternate Reality night.
Alternate Reality (Day Ability) - Create a reality where you and your target can talk. You can not use this ability on The King, Unseen or cult members, Prince, A Jailed target or the mystic. Target can still use their ability. (2 uses)
Bend Reality (Day Ability) - Disable all day abilities and all current uses in effect. The only exception to this is Nightshade and Rupture. All whispers will be then directed to you and the court will not know it. (3 uses)
The Realmfinder - Unseen Social
Trance (Day Ability) - Make a player only hearable to the unseen. Whispers will be shared to all of you and they will still think they are talking to the court. Telepathy will still go out to everyone. Day Abilities will target you. Except scout. The king can not be targeted (Unlimited uses)
Shatter Reality (Day Ability) - It's Bend Reality but also disabling investigative abilities.
The Cult Converted Class Is The Apostle. This Class Is Non-unique, Not conversion immune. Not death immune, Not Occupation immune.

item.title: The Realityseeker/Realmfinder
item.dc:creator: Marcus_Doodalee
item.description:
Just a hamiltonian dude,

SabreOverdrive:

Warp Perception (Passive) - Both you and your target is immune to occupation, Redirection, Conversion and death in a Alternate Reality nigh

hmmmm, so its a little similar to hunter’s bear, except it affects two people, I think occ/redirection is a little unnecessary.

SabreOverdrive:

Alternate Reality (Day Ability) - Create a reality where you and your target can talk. You can not use this ability on The King, Unseen or cult members, Prince, A Jailed target or the mystic. Target can still use their ability. (2 uses)

This is pretty similar to mystic except that if you manage to use it on someone, you confirm them as:
Not Unseen/Cult/Mystic/Prince/Jailed, which is a pretty decent investigative ability in of itself.

SabreOverdrive:

Bend Reality (Day Ability) - Disable all day abilities and all current uses in effect. The only exception to this is Nightshade and Rupture. All whispers will be then directed to you and the court will not know it. (3 uses)

Except the court will know it when suddenly people stop getting messages to each other, king only has to say

“Realityseeker game, whisper me.”
no whispers received
kk RS confirmed

SabreOverdrive:

Trance (Day Ability) - Make a player only hearable to the unseen. Whispers will be shared to all of you and they will still think they are talking to the court. Telepathy will still go out to everyone. Day Abilities will target you. Except scout. The king can not be targeted (Unlimited uses)

Interesting niche

SabreOverdrive:

Shatter Reality (Day Ability) - It’s Bend Reality but also disabling investigative abilities.

Investigative day abilities or also investigative night abilities?

I’m sort of okay w/ this class in it’s current state, It doesn’t do anything at night, so its not completely broken.

item.title: The Realityseeker/Realmfinder
item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
Look, it might seem like I’m attacking your idea here.

Blue Dragon social classes have the nasty problem of being ridiculously easily confirmable. Having two, currently (with one of them being unique), prevents the problem of bloat.

There is no problem with your class. I even find it quite interesting. An inverse mystic in some manner (although it should probably be able to be used on unseen/cult).

SabreOverdrive:

Do you just want me to make another damn noble?

Definitely not. Noble holds specific domain on reading whispers as a BD class, so making another with the same jurisdiction would create redundancy.

Social classes are almost entirely impossible to make balanced around not being confirmable. I apologize for my more frustrated response, it wasn’t good of me to do so.

SabreOverdrive:

Technically 1. It has two uses. Just use one then convert. You can say you use it on another unseen member. It’ll confirm you both

A converted mystic can say they did the exact same thing instead of linking prince.

SabreOverdrive:

Non-unique

We had this problem where there was a possibility for two mystics. Make it unique.

If you were to make this class unique (and if they were to mess with the algorithm so that this and mystic are unlikely to spawn together), maaaybe it would work.

The problem, as stated before, is how easily confirmable this class is, while also being able to spawn up to 3 times in the same game as a mystic.
